section.note: The Sending an Email topic describes a technique available to Alpha Anywhere database users.

section.description: This tutorial shows how to build an email client into your application. There are two pages. The first allows you to compose and send an email. The second page confirms a successfully sent message and allows you to return to the previous page to send another message.
section.note: This example presumes that you have configured the internal Alpha Anywhere Email Client.

case.description: Change the Submit/Reset Buttons > Submit button label to "Send Email".
Click the '...' in the Freeform Edit Regions > Above Dialog field to display the HTML Editor.
Enter "Send an Email Message". Set the style to "Heading 3", the font to "Comic Sans MS", and the size to "4 (14pt)".
Check Client Events > Validate before submit.
Click '...' in the Server Events > Validate field to display the Form Events dialog. Add the following code. This script uses the EMAIL_SEND() function to send the message.
case.example: dim result as N result = email_send(to,subject,message) if (result <> 1) then CurrentForm.Has_Error = .T. CurrentForm.Error_Message = "Email was not sent." end if
